recentPerformance.cushion: Getting points as road underdog with 6-3 record

keyFactors.title: Elite Defensive Front
keyFactors.description: Eagles ranked 5th in QB pressures and just acquired Jaelan Phillips from Miami. Defensive line featuring Phillips, Jalyx Hunt, and Nakobe Dean posed major threat to Jordan Love.

keyFactors.title: Getting Points with Better Record
keyFactors.description: Eagles entered 6-3 while Packers were 5-4. Philadelphia getting +1.5 points despite superior record and coming off bye week preparation.

keyFactors.title: Road Underdog Value
keyFactors.description: NFL road underdogs getting 1-3 points historically cover at 53% rate. Eagles' defense travels well.

riskFactors: Lambeau Field in November creates significant home-field advantage
Jordan Love's efficiency at home (9-2 career at Lambeau)
Eagles' offense coming off bye could be rusty

scoringBreakdown.description: Scoreless through halftime - first 0-0 halftime NFL game since December 2023. Defensive dominance on both sides.
Jake Elliott 39-yard FG gave Eagles 3-0 lead to open second half. Defense continued shutout.

DeVonta Smith 36-yard TD reception from Jalen Hurts extended lead to 10-0 with 10:35 left. Josh Jacobs 6-yard TD cut it to 10-7 with 5:49 remaining. Eagles sealed win with 4th-and-1 stop (Jacobs fumble) at 1:26.

gameResults.whenCleared: Q4 - Eagles won outright 10-7, covering +1.5 by 4.5 points
gameResults.gamePace: Defensive struggle throughout. Eagles' pass rush (3 sacks of Love, 8 QB hits) and ball control (32:05 TOP) dominated. Philadelphia improved to 7-2, Packers fell to 5-3-1.

whatWentRight.title: Jaelan Phillips Debut Dominated
whatWentRight.description: Phillips' Eagles debut was spectacular - 7 QB pressures, fumble recovery, constant disruption of Jordan Love. Trade acquisition paid immediate dividends.

whatWentRight.title: Won Outright as Road Underdog
whatWentRight.description: Eagles didn't just cover +1.5, they won outright 10-7. Margin of 4.5 points exceeded spread comfortably despite low-scoring affair.

whatWentRight.title: Defensive Dominance
whatWentRight.description: Held Packers to 7 points, 261 total yards, forced 2 turnovers. Critical 4th-and-1 stop (Jacobs fumble) with 1:26 left sealed victory.

whatWentRight.title: DeVonta Smith Game-Winner
whatWentRight.description: Smith's 36-yard TD catch gave Eagles 10-0 cushion with 10:35 left. Crucial score in low-scoring game.

statisticalContext.percentileRanking: 92nd percentile defensive performance - held Packers to 7 points

closingLineValue.verdict: Slight positive CLV - line barely moved, showing sharp money on Eagles.

keyTakeaways: Road underdogs +1.5 with better records provide excellent value - Eagles 6-3 vs Packers 5-4
Defensive line dominance translates to spread covers - Phillips' 7 pressures led to outright win
Low-scoring games favor underdogs - 10-7 final made +1.5 cushion comfortable
Bye week preparation showed - Eagles' game plan dominated Packers
Critical 4th-and-1 stop sealed cover and outright victory
verdict: Perfect road underdog spot. Eagles' superior record (6-3 vs 5-4), elite defensive front, and bye week preparation made +1.5 excellent value. Phillips' dominant debut (7 pressures) and Smith's TD catch delivered outright 10-7 win. Defensive slugfests favor underdogs - Eagles covered by 4.5 points despite just 10 points scored.
